items.text: A Psalm for Solomon.
items.plainText: A Psalm for Solomon.

items.text: Give the king thy judgments, O God, and thy righteousness unto the king's son.
items.plainText: Give the king thy judgments, O God, and thy righteousness unto the king's son.

items.text: He shall judge thy people with righteousness, and thy poor with judgment.
items.plainText: He shall judge thy people with righteousness, and thy poor with judgment.

items.text: The mountains shall bring peace to the people, and the little hills, by righteousness.
items.plainText: The mountains shall bring peace to the people, and the little hills, by righteousness.

items.text: He shall judge the poor of the people, he shall save the children of the needy, and shall break in pieces the oppressor.
items.plainText: He shall judge the poor of the people, he shall save the children of the needy, and shall break in pieces the oppressor.

items.text: They shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endure, throughout all generations.
items.plainText: They shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endure, throughout all generations.

items.text: He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass: as showers that water the earth.
items.plainText: He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass: as showers that water the earth.

items.text: In his days shall the righteous flourish; and abundance of peace so long as the moon endureth.
items.plainText: In his days shall the righteous flourish; and abundance of peace so long as the moon endureth.

items.text: He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the earth.
items.plainText: He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the earth.

items.text: They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him; and his enemies shall lick the dust.
items.plainText: They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him; and his enemies shall lick the dust.

items.text: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents: the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.
items.plainText: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents: the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.

items.text: Yea, all kings shall fall down before him: all nations shall serve him.
items.plainText: Yea, all kings shall fall down before him: all nations shall serve him.

items.text: For he shall deliver the needy when he crieth; the poor also, and him that hath no helper.
items.plainText: For he shall deliver the needy when he crieth; the poor also, and him that hath no helper.

items.text: He shall spare the poor and needy, and shall save the souls of the needy.
items.plainText: He shall spare the poor and needy, and shall save the souls of the needy.

items.text: He shall redeem their soul from deceit and violence: and precious shall their blood be in his sight.
items.plainText: He shall redeem their soul from deceit and violence: and precious shall their blood be in his sight.

items.text: And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba: prayer also shall be made for him continually; and daily shall he be praised.
items.plainText: And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba: prayer also shall be made for him continually; and daily shall he be praised.

items.text: There shall be an handful of corn in the earth upon the top of the mountains; the fruit thereof shall shake like Lebanon: and they of the city shall flourish like grass of the earth.
items.plainText: There shall be an handful of corn in the earth upon the top of the mountains; the fruit thereof shall shake like Lebanon: and they of the city shall flourish like grass of the earth.

items.text: His name shall endure for ever: his name shall be continued as long as the sun: and men shall be blessed in him: all nations shall call him blessed.
items.plainText: His name shall endure for ever: his name shall be continued as long as the sun: and men shall be blessed in him: all nations shall call him blessed.

items.text: Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, who only doeth wondrous things.
items.plainText: Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, who only doeth wondrous things.

items.text: And blessed be his glorious name for ever: and let the whole earth be filled with his glory; Amen, and Amen.
items.plainText: And blessed be his glorious name for ever: and let the whole earth be filled with his glory; Amen, and Amen.

items.text: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.
items.plainText: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.
